contents.en: Hi,I’m Marvin.
My name is Robert.
You can call me Beth.
Are you Tina?
Yes,I am.
Meet my friend.
This is my brother,Thomas.
Come say hi to my parents.
Have you met my sister?
Have we met before?
Do I know you?
I’m new around here.
Let me introduce myself.
I didn’t catch your name.
contents.zh: 我没有听清楚你的名字。

contents.en: I’m like to introduce you to my boss.
contents.zh: 我想把你介绍给我的老板。

contents.en: Thanks.
Thank you.
Don’t mention it.
You’re welcome.
I really appreciate this.
Thanks for your help.
Is there someway I can repay you for this?
contents.zh: 有什么方法可以让我为此对你进行回报？

contents.en: This is a big favor.
You’ve been a big help.
I can’t express how grateful I am.
contents.zh: 我无法表达我的感激之情。

contents.en: I’m much obliged.
You don’t know how much this means to me.
contents.zh: 你不知道这（个忙）对我有多重要。

contents.en: You’re too kind.
Thank you for everything you’ve done.
I’m indebted to you.
I’m sorry.
I apologize.
I’m so sorry.
I’m sorry for criticizing you.
It doesn’t matter.
I really regret going to the movies last week.
contents.zh: 我真的很后悔上个星期去看了电影。

contents.en: I wish I hadn’t said that at the party.
contents.zh: 我希望我当时在聚会上没说那些话。

contents.en: I’m sorry I was late for class today.
contents.zh: 很抱歉，我今天上课迟到了。

contents.en: You can blame me for this.
I’ll take the blame.
Can you forgive me?
Please accept my apology.
Can I make this up to you?
contents.zh: 我能为此对你做些补偿吗？

contents.en: How can I apologize to you?
This is all my fault.
I have to get going.
See you later.
See you.
I should go now.
Good-bye.
I’ll talk to you later.
I’ve got to get going.
I’m better run.
I’ll see you around.
I’ll catch you later.
Until we meet again.
Keep in touch.
We should meet again.
It was nice meeting you.
Take care.
I don’t feel like cooking.
I like Chinese food.
I love dogs.
I don’t like him.
Do you like football?
I hate the Yankees.
I’m crazy about pizza.
I’m craving something to eat.
I don’t care for your opinion.
contents.zh: 我不喜欢/赞同你的意见。

contents.en: I care about you a great deal.
I loathe the sight of you.
I’m fond of Italian music.
He doesn’t find his job very appealing.
contents.zh: 他并不觉得他的工作有趣。

contents.en: She’s attracted to fast cars.
I can’t stand these people.
I hope we win the tournament this year.
contents.zh: 我希望我们能赢今年的比赛。

contents.en: I hope so too.
What do you want for Christmas this year?
contents.zh: 今年圣诞节你想要什么（礼物）？

contents.en: I wish it would stop raining.
I was thinking about going to that new place.
contents.zh: 我在考虑去那个新地方。

contents.en: I want to be a doctor.
I trust that all will be well.
I believe things will get better.
I could really use a drink right now.
I hope she feels better.
Their only desire is for a new home.
contents.zh: 他们唯一的期望是有个新家。

contents.en: He’s the best hope for the team.
I keep hoping that things will get better.
contents.zh: 我一直都希望事情会好转。

contents.en: I have to have that car.
I need to be alone.
Oh,it’s wonderful.
Really?
This is such a surprise!
Wow,I’m so happy!
Can you believe what our teacher did today?
contents.zh: 你简直不能相信我们老师今天做了什么事情?

contents.en: This comes as a surprise.
The best thing happened to me today.
contents.zh: 今天对我来说最好的一件事情。

contents.en: This is better than expected.
How delightful!
This is incredible.
I can’t believe how good this is.
contents.zh: 这好得简直让我难以置信。

contents.en: This is terrific.
That’s fantastic.
Well,this is a nice surprise.
I’m delighted to see you.
I suggest you start thinking about careers with animals.
contents.zh: 我建议你开始考虑与动物相关的职业。

contents.en: My advice to you is to enjoy those things.
contents.zh: 我给你的建议就是去享受那些东西。

contents.en: I’ll think about it.
Can I give you some advice?
What do you suggest?
Can I give you some insights?
I suggest you do what he says.
contents.zh: 我建议你按照他说的去做。

contents.en: My advice would be to go home.
Is that your advice?
What would you do in my shoes?
contents.zh: 如果你处在我的位置，你会怎么做？

contents.en: I’d recommend that you try to relax.
May I make a suggestion?
What do you think I should do?
Let me give you a bit of advice.
What would be your advice?
Congratulations.
I’m sure you deserve it.
I’m sure you’ll do fine.
Good luck.
I wish you the best.
That’s great.
Outstanding.
Allow me to congratulate you.
I wish you well.
You have my best wishes.
Good job.
Please accept my warmest congratulations.
contents.zh: 请接受我最热诚的祝贺。

contents.en: I must congratulate you.
I wish you nothing but the best.
I wish you good luck.
I just want to get this mess straightened out.
contents.zh: 我想整理一下这乱糟糟的一团。

contents.en: I hate this weather.
It’s sucked.
I have had it up to here with this guy.
I’ve got a real problem with one of my co-workers.
contents.zh: 我有个同事真让我受不了。

contents.en: This is awful.
I can’t stand this.
I’m going to complain about this.
I’m fed up with your behavior.
I’ve had it up to here with you.
This is intolerable.
I will not accept this situation.
I will not stand for this.
I’m going to give him a piece of my mind.
I want to make a complaint.
Let’s get out of here.
Do you want to come?
Thanks for the invitation.
I was going to invite you in for some coffee.
contents.zh: 我想请你进来喝点咖啡。

contents.en: I’m like to invite you to a match.
contents.zh: 我想请你去看一场比赛。

contents.en: Do you want to get some lunch?
Why don’t you come over later?
Are you free tonight?
What are you doing later?
Let’s meet later.
Come see me sometime.
Give me a call the next time you’re in town.
contents.zh: 你下次再来的时候给我打个电话。

contents.en: I’m like to see you again.
Would you like to get dinner sometime?
When can I see you again?
contents.zh: 我什么时候能再见到你？

contents.en: I keep asking her to turn down her music.
contents.zh: 我一直叫她把音乐关小声点。

contents.en: It’s a small request.
She has to turn it down.
I’m just requesting that you keep him in your yard.
contents.zh: 我只是要求你让他呆在你的院子里。

contents.en: I need to borrow your computer.
contents.zh: 我需要借用一下你的电脑。

contents.en: Can I see that book?
Could you move over a little bit?
You’re requested to be in court next week.
My request for a raise was rejected.
contents.zh: 我加薪的请求被拒绝了。

contents.en: Can I make one small request?
contents.zh: 我能提一个小小的要求吗？

contents.en: That’s a pretty big request.
Why don’t you just request some help at work?
contents.zh: 你为什么不要求一些工作上的帮助呢？

contents.en: This is one of the most requested songs on the radio.
contents.zh: 这是收音机里点唱率最高的歌曲之一。

contents.en: Could you give me a hand with this box?
contents.zh: 你能帮我搬搬这箱子吗？

contents.en: Would you mind being a little bit quieter?
I’ll keep thinking about it.
We may just have to share my car for a while.
contents.zh: 一段时间里，也许我们不得不共用我的车。

contents.en: We need to start a college fund for Tyler.
contents.zh: 我们必须为泰勒设立一个大学基金。

contents.en: Do you know what you’re doing after graduation?
contents.zh: 你知道你毕业后做什么吗？

contents.en: I haven’t made up my mind yet.
I’ll let you know what I decide.
contents.zh: 我会让你知道我的决定的。

contents.en: I have to make a difficult choice.
contents.zh: 我必须做一个艰难的选择。

contents.en: Decide quickly.
I hadn’t anticipated that.
What do you plan to do about this mess?
contents.zh: 面对这一团糟，你打算怎么办?

contents.en: The disaster was a result of poor planning.
contents.zh: 这次灾难是由于计划不周导致的。

contents.en: I plan to take the next train out of here.
contents.zh: 我打算坐下一班火车离开这里。

contents.en: I intend to buy a new house.
I had only the best intentions.
Everything is going according to plan.
To be honest,I’m not certain.
Maybe.
I couldn’t say for sure.
I couldn’t say for definite.
contents.zh: 我没有百分之百的把握。

contents.en: I couldn’t say absolutely.
I’m positive that he did it.
I’m certain of it.
I’m not sure that’s a good idea.
contents.zh: 我不能肯定那是个好主意。

contents.en: I can’t be certain of what time I left the office.
contents.zh: 我不能肯定我是什么时候离开办公室的。

contents.en: I’ve no idea where my shoes are.
contents.zh: 我不知道我的鞋子在哪。

contents.en: I’m not certain if he’s telling the truth.
contents.zh: 我不能肯定他是否在说真话。

contents.en: Are you certain this is what you want to do?
contents.zh: 你能肯定这是你想做的吗？

contents.en: I swear this is the truth.
I have no doubt about how I feel.
contents.zh: 我对我的感觉深信不移。

contents.en: Absolutely.
I don’t think our taxes get anything good for us.
contents.zh: 我认为税收对我们没有任何好处。

contents.en: I disagree completely.
Maybe you’re right.
I think that’s a good idea.
I’m glad we see eye to eye.
contents.zh: 很高兴我们的看法一致。

contents.en: I couldn’t agree with you more.
I have to disagree with you on this.
contents.zh: 在这件事情上我不同意你的看法。

contents.en: That’s what I was thinking.
You are exactly right.
That’s for sure.
I’m say that was true.
Don’t you agree?
I’ll go along with that.
I’ll go along with you on this one.
contents.zh: 在这一点上我同意你的看法。

contents.en: I’m not sure I agree with you.
contents.zh: 我不能肯定我同意你的意见。

contents.en: Do your kids still believe in Santa Claus?
contents.zh: 你的孩子还相信有圣诞老人吗？

contents.en: How come you never believe me?
contents.zh: 你怎么从来都不相信我？

contents.en: I’m sure he’ll find a way to do that without more taxes.
contents.zh: 我确信他会找到一种无需交更多税收去做那件事的方法。

contents.en: I can’t believe it.
They believed that certain gods caused things in nature.
contents.zh: 他们相信自然界的事物是由某些神引起的。

contents.en: I have faith in the government.
I believe that I can do anything if I try hard enough.
contents.zh: 我相信如果我足够尽力去做的话，我能做任何事情。

contents.en: I don’t believe you.
Do you believe in anything?
I have no choice but to believe what you’re saying.
contents.zh: 我除了相信你的话，别无选择。

contents.en: Have you questioned your beliefs?
contents.zh: 你对你的信仰质疑过吗？

contents.en: I can’t believe you’ve said that.
contents.zh: 我不能相信你竟说出那样的话。

contents.en: I’m convinced by his words.
I believe he can be trusted.
I’ll take your word for it.
You did a good job.
Most of that was luck.
You have really good taste.
I am so jealous of you.
That’s a nice car you have there.
You’re looking good.
That shirt really becomes you.
contents.zh: 那件衬衫真的很适合你。

contents.en: You have excellent manners.
I salute your efforts.
contents.zh: 我对你的努力表示敬佩。

contents.en: You’re the best in the business.
You’re the envy of the town.
You look good in red.
You’ve done a good job with this house.
Keep up the good work.
I love the way you make me laugh.
Don’t worry about it.
That’s what counts.
That makes me feel a little better.
Look at the bright side.
That’s understandable.
Don’t let it get you down.
Things will get better.
Just keep trying.
Don’t give up.
We all have bad days sometimes.
contents.zh: 我们都会有不顺利的时候。

contents.en: I know how you feel.
I’m here for you.
contents.zh: 有什么要帮忙的，我就在你身边。

contents.en: It’s okay.
It’s not your fault.
No one blames you.
There’s a sign outside the gate that reads “NO TRESPASSING”.
contents.zh: 门外有牌子，上面写着“禁止入内”。

contents.en: Not here.
I don’t think you should do that.
contents.zh: 我认为你不应该那样做。

contents.en: They can’t stop me from smoking.
You can’t go there.
That’s forbidden.
I’m warning you.
No one is allowed to go in there.
It is forbidden to do that.
NO SMOKING
DO NOT ENTER
NO UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY
DO NOT WALK ON THE GRASS
KEEP OUT
NO PETS ALLOWED
What do you think of the new boss?
Do you mean Mr. Li?
Some people don’t listen to him.
Don’t get me wrong.
He seems like a pretty nice guy.
His uncle is very unusual.
My co-worker is too loud.
The new girl doesn’t do any work.
contents.zh: 那个新来的女孩什么工作也不做。

contents.en: His parents are too strict on him.
My brother is always in trouble at school.
contents.zh: 我的弟弟总是在学校惹祸。

contents.en: John is the best player we have.
contents.zh: 约翰是我们最好的队员。

contents.en: Harold comes from Canada.
Luke has a very excitable nature.
Paul thinks driving too fast is exciting.
contents.zh: 保罗认为开快车很令人兴奋。

contents.en: Sally doesn’t like spicy foods.
contents.zh: 莎丽不喜欢辛辣的食物。

contents.en: The living room is large enough for a good number of people.
contents.zh: 起居室足够大，可以容纳很多人。

contents.en: The only problem is that it has carpet from wall to wall.
contents.zh: 唯一的问题是，它的地毯和墙壁相联。

contents.en: That seems clumsy.
It looks kind of light.
It’s not heavy.
The keys on the keyboard sometimes get stuck.
contents.zh: 键盘上的按键有时会卡住。

contents.en: The open windows give the room more light.
contents.zh: 开着的窗户让房间更加明亮。

contents.en: The walls are too dark.
The floor is very clean.
This table is not stable.
There are stains on my new shirt.
I bought this toy in Beijing.
contents.zh: 这玩具是我在北京买的。

contents.en: This book is written in French.
I have to fix my sink in the kitchen.
contents.zh: 我必须修理厨房的水槽。

contents.en: My bicycle has a flat tire.
contents.zh: 我的自行车有一个胎爆了。

titles.en: lesson23 ASKING ABOUT AGE AND NAME

contents.en: It’s Janet Abrams.
I’m Tom Dickens.
What’s your name?
And how old are you,Mr. Fowler?
I’ll be 29 in May.
contents.zh: 我五月份就二十九岁了。

contents.en: I’m going on 40 next month.
I didn’t catch your name.
How old did you say you were?
People call me Tom.
When did you finish college?
contents.zh: 你什么时候读完大学的？

contents.en: What did you say your name was?
Do you go by your first name at work?
contents.zh: 在工作中，你是使用你的名吗？

contents.en: My name means “joy” in Spanish.
contents.zh: 我的名字在西班牙语中的意思是“快乐”。

contents.en: I’m named after my grandfather.
contents.zh: 我的名字是跟着我祖父取的。

titles.en: lesson24 ASKING ABOUT COUNTRIES AND NATIONALITIES
titles.zh: 询问有关国家和民族的事

contents.en: Where are you from?
I’m from Pittsburgh.
I’m Russian.
Why are you in the U.S.?
When did you get to this country?
contents.zh: 你什么时候来这个国家的？

contents.en: You look Spanish.
Were you born in America?
My parents came to this country before I was born.
contents.zh: 在我出生前我父母就来到了这个国家。

contents.en: What nationality are you?
Are you a citizen or a resident of this country?
contents.zh: 你是这个国家的公民还是居民？

contents.en: How long have you been here?
I just came back from Korea.
My ancestors came here from Ireland.
contents.zh: 我的祖先从爱尔兰来到这里。

contents.en: My girlfriend is from Mexico.
contents.zh: 我的女朋友来自墨西哥。

contents.en: I was born in England.
What time is it?
It’s about half past 3.
What time will you be back by?
My last class is over at 3:30.
contents.zh: 我最后一节课是在三点半结束。

contents.en: I’m going out for a few hours.
What time do you have?
It’s time to leave.
It’s almost time to go home.
We only have an hour of work left.
contents.zh: 我们只剩下一个小时的工作了。

contents.en: I’ve been waiting here for three hours.
Time goes by fast when you’re having fun.
contents.zh: 当你开心的时候，时间过得很快。

contents.en: It’s a quarter past eleven.
It’s fifteen minutes to nine.
The game starts at nine in the morning.
The office opens at 8 a.m.
When was the Declaration of Independence?
contents.zh: 《独立宣言》是什么时候宣布的？

contents.en: Our spring break is from April 2 to April 16.
contents.zh: 我们的春假是从四月二号到四月十六号。

contents.en: What’s tomorrow’s date?
Tomorrow is November 25.
contents.zh: 明天是十一月二十五号。

contents.en: The convention starts on the 24th of March.
contents.zh: 公约于三月二十四日生效。

contents.en: I have to complete my taxes by April 15th.
contents.zh: 我必须在四月十五日之前交清税。

contents.en: Rent is due by the first of every month.
School starts on the 23rd.
We have 3 days left until the 4th of July.
contents.zh: 到七月四号，我们还剩下三天。

contents.en: Is the 30th on a Monday?
This office will be closed for the holidays.
The last game will be on the 9th of March.
contents.zh: 最后一场比赛将于三月九号举行。

contents.en: My birthday is on May 19th.
contents.zh: 我的生日在五月十九号。

contents.en: I have to finish this essay by next Tuesday.
contents.zh: 我必须在下星期二之前完成这论文。

contents.en: I leave for Germany on the 11th of next month.
contents.zh: 我下个月十一号去德国。

contents.en: It’s good weather for football.
It’s very crisp and cool.
It’s going to get cold fast.
This spring there is supposed to be a cold spell.
contents.zh: 据推测那儿今年的春天会很冷。

contents.en: We had a lot of rain this winter though.
contents.zh: 但是我们今年冬天下了很多雨。

contents.en: It’s blazing hot outside.
With all this moisture,it feels very muggy outside.
contents.zh: 由于湿气很重，外面很闷热。

contents.en: It’s raining pretty hard right now.
It’s starting to snow outside.
Some of the streets are almost flooded with rain.
contents.zh: 有些街道几乎被雨水淹了。

contents.en: It’s freezing outside.
It’s a little bit chilly out.
The air is warm,but there’s a nice breeze.
contents.zh: 空气很热，但是有怡人的微风。

contents.en: This morning is cooler than expected.
contents.zh: 今天早上比预计的要凉快。

contents.en: It will get warmer as the day goes by.
Do you need my help?
I was hoping you could help.
Could you loan them to me?
I appreciate this very much.
I’m just glad to be of assistance.
Is there something I can do?
How can I help you?
I could use some help here.
What can I help you with?
Can I be of any assistance?
I don’t need any help.
Help me,please.
Could you lend me a hand?
That would be very helpful.
Your help would be appreciated.
I’m looking for 524 Maryland Avenue.
It’s about one mile over that way.
contents.zh: 顺着那条路，大约有一英里。

contents.en: Could you tell me how to get there?
contents.zh: 你能告诉我如何到那儿吗？

contents.en: For how long should I walk?
Then you take a right on Fulton.
contents.zh: 然后你在富顿大街往右拐。

contents.en: What’s the fastest way to Belton Street?
contents.zh: 到贝尔顿大街走哪条路最快？

contents.en: Do you know how to get to the stadium?
contents.zh: 你知道怎么去体育馆吗？

contents.en: Is there a road with less traffic on it?
contents.zh: 有没有交通稀疏一点的路？

contents.en: My house is two doors down from the Post Office.
contents.zh: 过了邮局再走两家就是我家了。

contents.en: The bus station will be on your left.
Which way is north?
Is this the way to the police station?
What street is this?
Do you know where the zoo is?
contents.zh: 你知道动物园在哪儿吗？

contents.en: Is this the east gate of the park?
I hate driving to work this way.
contents.zh: 我讨厌这样开车去上班。

contents.en: I’m sick of it.
It should be banned.
I am not happy with our new boss.
contents.zh: 我不喜欢我们的新老板。

contents.en: I don’t think schools are as good as they used to be.
contents.zh: 我认为现在的学校不如以前好了。

contents.en: I think we need a new president.
contents.zh: 我认为我们需要一位新总裁。

contents.en: Bob isn’t doing a good job.
I’m happy with the new mayor.
The bus driver seems lost.
contents.zh: 这位公共汽车司机好像是迷路了。

contents.en: My mother talks too much.
I have a lot of respect for my grandfather.
I love watching sports on TV.
contents.zh: 我喜欢看电视上的体育节目。

contents.en: I don’t like big cities very much.
My girlfriend is beautiful.
I think we should take a break.
contents.zh: 我认为我们应该休息一下。

contents.en: Thank you for calling Joe’s Pizza.
contents.zh: 感谢您打电话到乔氏比萨店。

contents.en: Hello?
Is that Ivy?
This is Professor Smith.
I’ll call you tomorrow.
To who am I speaking?
Who am I talking to?
How can I direct your call?
contents.zh: 要我把您的电话转给谁？

contents.en: You’ve got the wrong number.
What number is this?
Who do you want to talk to?
He isn’t here right now.
Can I have him call you back?
contents.zh: 让我叫他给你回电话吗？

contents.en: Can I call you back later?
contents.zh: 我呆会儿再打给你好吗？

contents.en: What number can I reach you at?
contents.zh: 我打什么号码能找到你？

contents.en: I need to make an appointment.
How about sometime next week?
That should be fine.
I’ll set it up.
I wanted to set up a time to meet with you.
contents.zh: 我想约个时间和你见面。

contents.en: When would be a good time to get together?
Are you free later this week?
contents.zh: 这个星期的后几天你有空吗？

contents.en: When can I talk to you?
contents.zh: 我什么时候能和你谈谈？

contents.en: What are you doing next Thursday?
Do you want to talk about this some other time?
contents.zh: 你想什么时候再谈谈这个吗？

contents.en: I want to make a reservation for next Friday.
contents.zh: 我想预定下个星期五的（房间等）。

contents.en: I can come in tomorrow.
Can you come in the afternoon?
Do you have any time available this week?
contents.zh: 这个星期你什么时候有空吗？

contents.en: When is your next opening?
contents.zh: 你下一次什么时候有空？

contents.en: Where are you going?
What are you doing now?
I don’t have to shave every day.
I usually take too long eating breakfast.
contents.zh: 我通常早餐吃很长时间。

contents.en: If I don’t eat breakfast,then I don’t have enough energy during the day.
contents.zh: 如果我不吃早餐的话，我就一天都没有足够的能量。

contents.en: I’ve got to go brush my teeth.
I don’t have time to take a shower now.
I never have time for lunch at work.
contents.zh: 我上班时从来都没有时间吃午饭。

contents.en: Everyday I have to drive 40 minutes to work.
contents.zh: 我每天必须开车四十分钟去上班。

contents.en: Did the mail come today?
Have you seen today’s paper?
I watch the news every night.
I like to exercise in the morning.
Most nights I just go out to eat.
contents.zh: 大部分的晚上我在外面吃饭。

contents.en: Did you take the dog for a walk?
Did you have a good day at work?
It kind of reminds me of that trip we took with Mom and Dad to Canada.
contents.zh: 这有点让我想起了我们和爸爸妈妈去加拿大的那次旅行。

contents.en: I don’t remember how cold it was though.
contents.zh: 但是我记不起来有多冷了。

contents.en: Where exactly did we go in Canada?
contents.zh: 我们去了加拿大的哪儿？

contents.en: How could I possibly forget?
I didn’t run out of money.
I used to like surfing.
I once had a fever for almost a week.
contents.zh: 我有一次发了近一个星期的高烧。

contents.en: I broke my leg skiing five years ago.
contents.zh: 五年前我滑雪的时候摔断了腿。

contents.en: This reminds me of my trip to France.
contents.zh: 这让我想起了我的法国之旅。

contents.en: I’ve only been on an airplane once.
I used to live in Mexico.
I got in a car accident last year.
My dog saved my life one time.
I spent 3 years in the army.
I loved to go fishing with my dad.
contents.zh: 我喜欢和我爸爸一起去钓鱼。

contents.en: I once went skydiving with my friends.
contents.zh: 我曾经和朋友一起参加过跳伞运动。

contents.en: I think we’re going to save some extra money this year.
contents.zh: 我想我们今年会多存些钱。

contents.en: What language are you going to study?
Then don’t complain to me when Spanish gets boring.
contents.zh: 当你觉得西班牙语令你厌烦的时候，别向我诉苦。

contents.en: What are you doing later this week?
contents.zh: 这个星期的后几天你打算干什么？

contents.en: Are you still planning to go to medical school?
contents.zh: 你还在打算去医学院吗？

contents.en: I want to buy a dog.
I’m going to switch job soon.
We’re like to send our daughter to a private school.
contents.zh: 我们想把我们的女儿送到私立学校去。

contents.en: I hope to get good grades this year.
contents.zh: 我希望今年能取得好成绩。

contents.en: I will be moving in six months.
I’m going to study Chinese next year.
I want to work for my dad’s company.
contents.zh: 我想为我爸爸的公司工作。

contents.en: My parents are going on vacation next month.
contents.zh: 我的父母下个月去度假。

contents.en: In two years I will finish medical school.
contents.zh: 两年后我就要从医学院毕业了。

contents.en: My wife wants to buy a new car.
How’s your biology class going?
It’s interesting,but there’s so much work.
contents.zh: 很有趣，但是作业太多了。

contents.en: It’s just my opinion,but I think that’s pretty boring.
contents.zh: 这只是我的看法，我认为那很枯燥。

contents.en: I admit that is pretty interesting.
I hope you can keep up with the work.
Are you doing well in math class?
Do you understand the chemistry homework?
It’s hard to hear my English teacher.
contents.zh: 很难听清我的英语老师说话。

contents.en: I stayed up all night studying for this test.
contents.zh: 我一个晚上没睡，为这场测验做准备。

contents.en: Did you hear our teacher assigned another paper?
contents.zh: 你听到我们老师又布置了一篇论文了吗？

contents.en: I’m really bored with this class.
I like biology more than I first thought.
contents.zh: 我比当初想象的要更喜欢生物课。

contents.en: Could you help with the history homework?
contents.zh: 你能帮我做历史作业吗？

contents.en: I’m always late for my first class in the morning.
contents.zh: 早上的第一节课我总是迟到。

contents.en: I have to go study for my French class.

titles.en: lesson37 TALKING ABOUT FAMILIES AND RELATIVES

contents.en: He likes fishing.
He’s a lawyer.
It doesn’t make any sense for them to still be mad at you.
contents.zh: 他们还生你的气,这没有道理。

contents.en: She’s a natural entertainer.
When he was a little boy,he was a real troublemaker.
contents.zh: 当他还是个小孩子的时候,真是一个小捣蛋鬼。

contents.en: My father can be a real grouch.
contents.zh: 我父亲有时候真爱发牢骚。

contents.en: My parents almost never fight.
contents.zh: 我的父母几乎从不吵架。

contents.en: His brother is very protective.
Her sister is very jealous.
My mother enjoys the piano.
I have two sisters and one brother.
contents.zh: 我有两个姐姐和一个哥哥。

contents.en: My wife and I just had a baby boy.
contents.zh: 我妻子和我刚生了一个男婴。

contents.en: We’ve been married for eleven years.
My uncle’s wife just died.
contents.zh: 我叔叔的妻子刚去世了。

contents.en: I was adopted as an infant.
contents.zh: 我婴儿时候就被收养了。

contents.en: Where?
What is it?
Is it a tiger?
It’s like a dinosaur.
Who’s that man?
That’s a barbershop.
You’re looking at my latest work of art.
contents.zh: 你正在看我最新的艺术作品。

contents.en: That’s my house on the left.
contents.zh: 左边的那幢就是我的房子。

contents.en: The man in blue is my uncle.
contents.zh: 那个穿蓝色衣服的就是我叔叔。

contents.en: I think the man in the suit is a police officer.
contents.zh: 我想穿西装的那个男人是一名警官。

contents.en: His name tag says he is a doctor.
contents.zh: 他的名牌上说他是一名医生。

contents.en: The brown car belongs to my sister.
contents.zh: 这辆棕色的车是我姐姐的。

contents.en: I think the red car is Japanese.
contents.zh: 我想这辆红色的车是日本车。

contents.en: I think that animal is a tiger.
Those are my shoes under the chair.
What does he look like?
He’s kind of tall and thin.
He has a long nose.
He always wears funny ties.
contents.zh: 他总是系着滑稽的领带。

contents.en: What does it look like?
It’s just a dark blue wool cap.
contents.zh: 那只是一顶深蓝色的羊毛帽子。

contents.en: My brother is a thin man.
I live in a brick house.
The car is very fast.
This bus is very old.
Have you seen a yellow hat around here?
contents.zh: 你在这附近看过一顶黄色帽子吗？

contents.en: I want the small kitten with the orange stripes.
contents.zh: 我想要这只有桔黄色条纹的小猫。

contents.en: Can you give me a description of the person?
contents.zh: 你能给我描述一下这个人吗？

contents.en: She has a round face and large eyes.
contents.zh: 她有一张圆圆的脸蛋，大大的眼睛。

contents.en: The soup was full of many different vegetables
contents.zh: 这汤中有许多不同的蔬菜。

titles.en: lesson40 ASKING SOMEBODY TO DO SOMETHING

contents.en: I need your help.
Could you lend me a hand for a second?
Could you do me a favor?
Excuse me.
Would you mind putting out that cigarette?
Could you turn down the music?
Just return the book when you’re finished with it.
contents.zh: 你一看完就把这书还回来。

contents.en: Could you edit this paper for me?
contents.zh: 你能帮我编辑一下这篇文章吗？

contents.en: Would you mind moving over a little?
Please stop talking so loud.
Why don’t you come with me to the store?
contents.zh: 你为什么不和我一起去商店呢？

contents.en: Can you lend me your car this afternoon?
contents.zh: 今天下午你能把你的车借给我么？

contents.en: Can you give me a ride into town?
Let me take a look at that picture.
Can I borrow your pen for a moment?
contents.zh: 我能借用一下你的钢笔吗？

contents.en: I just need you to sign your name here.我需要你在这里签名。
I was going over to the library to study.
I won’t get any studying done there at all.
contents.zh: 在那儿我根本就不能学习。

contents.en: I’m trying to finish the reading assignment for our physics class.
contents.zh: 我在尽力完成我们物理课的阅读作业。

contents.en: I’ve got to start preparing tonight.
The problem is that I missed two days of class last week.
contents.zh: 问题是我上个星期缺了两天的课。

contents.en: I’ve got to go to baseball practice.
Are you going to the class meeting later?
How many classes have you missed so far?
contents.zh: 到目前为止，你缺了多少课？

contents.en: He’s involved in too many sports and activities.
contents.zh: 他参加了太多的体育运动和其他活动。

contents.en: I’m going to the gym for a little bit.
contents.zh: 我要去体育馆锻炼一下。

contents.en: What are you writing about for your class paper?
I’ve got to go meet a professor.
Do you want to study together?
I’m going to get some coffee in the dining hall.
The dean wants to meet my parents.
contents.zh: 教务长想见见我的父母。

contents.en: Are these the books you’re checking out?
When are they due back?
It seems you still have a book overdue.
contents.zh: 看来你还有一本书过期了。

contents.en: You can have them for one month.
It’s $0.5 a day for overdue books.
contents.zh: 过期的书要收50美分一天。

contents.en: Do you have any books on Russia?
contents.zh: 你们有关于俄国方面的书吗？

contents.en: You’re not supposed to talk in the library.
Is the photocopier working?
That book is on reserve for a professor.
contents.zh: 那本书被一位教授预定了。

contents.en: We only have one copy of that book.
She is a very popular author.
contents.zh: 她是个很受欢迎的作者。

contents.en: This library needs to get some more up-to-date books.
contents.zh: 图书馆需要多一些最新的书。

contents.en: Where are the math books located?
What time does the library close today?
contents.zh: 图书馆今天什么时候关门？

contents.en: I hate when people write in library books.
contents.zh: 我讨厌别人在图书馆的书上写字。

contents.en: I’m really having a good time.
It’s too crowded to push my way through to the kitchen.
contents.zh: 人太多了,很难挤到厨房那边去。

contents.en: Do you know anybody at this party?
contents.zh: 在这聚会上，你认识什么人吗？

contents.en: I’m going to have some fun while I’m here.
contents.zh: 我会在这儿玩得开心的。

contents.en: Why don’t we stay for about half an hour to see if anyone else arrives?
contents.zh: 我们为什么不呆半个小时，看看有没有别的人来?

contents.en: I think we’re out of beer.
Did anyone invite that guy?
These parties are always so popular.
contents.zh: 这些聚会总是很受欢迎。

contents.en: There are too many older students here tonight.
contents.zh: 今晚这里有太多年纪大的学生了。

contents.en: Should I go talk to that girl over there?
contents.zh: 我应该过去和那个女孩说话吗？

contents.en: Can you tell me where the bathroom is?
contents.zh: 你能告诉我洗手间在哪吗？

contents.en: I think some people are leaving to go to another party.
contents.zh: 我想有些人在离开去参加另一个聚会了。

contents.en: You should slow down with the drinking.
I’m tired,so I’m going home.
contents.zh: 我累了，所以我要回家了。

contents.en: It’s always the same faces at these parties.
contents.zh: 这些聚会上，总是些老面孔。

contents.en: I guess this is a really popular movie.
contents.zh: 我猜想这是一部很受欢迎的电影。

contents.en: Are there any movies you want to see in case this one is sold out?
contents.zh: 万一这部电影没票了，你还想看别的吗？

contents.en: We’ve got a few minutes before the start of the movie.
contents.zh: 离电影开始还有几分钟。

contents.en: That movie was too scary.
There’s one out now about a talking horse.
contents.zh: 现在有一部关于一匹会说话的马的电影在公映。

contents.en: I think my seat is near the aisle.
contents.zh: 我想我的座位是靠近过道的。

contents.en: This theater is packed tonight.
contents.zh: 这个电影院今晚挤满了人。

contents.en: The film is sold out for tonight.
What time does the show start?
Let’s go find our seats.
The plot wasn’t very realistic.
The director seemed to rely mostly on special effects.
contents.zh: 看起来导演好像大部分依赖特技效果。

contents.en: This movie is based on a true story.
contents.zh: 这部电影是根据真实故事改编的。

contents.en: I think this scene was filmed in my hometown.
contents.zh: 我想这个场景是在我的家乡拍摄的。

contents.en: Can you believe how much a bag of popcorn costs at this theater?
contents.zh: 你简直不敢相信在这家电影院一袋爆米花要多少钱。

contents.en: He has an injured leg.
The doctor’s seeing him at this time.
contents.zh: 医生现在正在给他诊治。

contents.en: Do you know anything about his condition?
contents.zh: 你知道他现在的情况吗？

contents.en: I thought it might be more serious.
contents.zh: 我以为可能会更严重些。

contents.en: Your mother is now in stable condition.
contents.zh: 你母亲现在的病情稳定了。

contents.en: Which hand is bothering you?
How long has it been swollen?like that?
Can you roll up your sleeve for me to have a look?
contents.zh: 你能把袖子卷起来让我看看吗？

contents.en: Do you have any insurance?
Do you have a history of heart trouble?
We have no spare beds right now.
contents.zh: 我们现在没有多余的床位。

contents.en: The pain is mostly in my lower back.
Does it hurt when I do this?
I’ll write you a prescription.
You should take it easy on that leg for a few weeks.
contents.zh: 你的那条腿要休息几个星期。

contents.en: It’s not very exciting to wait in line at the post office.
contents.zh: 在邮局排着队等可不是什么好玩的事情。

contents.en: I’ve got to mail this stuff for my boss.
contents.zh: 我必须帮我老板把这东西邮寄了。

contents.en: It’s just a letter to my mother.
I need to have this package air mailed.
contents.zh: 我必须航空邮寄这包裹。

contents.en: I’ve been expecting a package that should have been here two weeks ago.
contents.zh: 我在等一个包裹，这个包裹两个星期前就应该到了。

contents.en: How much more does express mail cost?
contents.zh: 特快专递要多花多少钱？

contents.en: Can I get insurance on this package?
I need to change my mailing address.
contents.zh: 我需要更改我的邮政地址。

contents.en: This package weighs 11 ounces.
That’s the box of out-of-town mail.
How much for a book of stamps?
Can I get a postcard here?
Is there a supervisor that I can speak with?
contents.zh: 我能找一位主管谈谈吗？

contents.en: I like these new stamps.
Can I apply for a passport here?
you need to sign for this package.
contents.zh: 你需要签名领取这个包裹。

contents.en: Is this the right place to open up an account?
I need to start a bank account.
Will this be a checking or savings account?
contents.zh: 这是支票账户，还是储蓄账户？

contents.en: I’m told that I have insufficient funds.
What are your home loan interest rates?
contents.zh: 你住房贷款的利率是多少？

contents.en: Can you help me finance a car?
What’s my current balance?
My ATM card has stopped working.
You don’t need a passport for routine business.
contents.zh: 日常事务你不需要护照。

contents.en: I can’t remember my account number.
Is there a minimum balance needed for an account?
contents.zh: 这个账户有最低余额限制吗？

contents.en: I want traveler’s checks.
I have a joint account with my wife.
contents.zh: 我和我妻子有一个联名账户。

contents.en: Can I have a receipt for this?
Your account is overdrawn.
This soup is incredible! Have you tried it yet?
contents.zh: 这汤真是不错！你尝过吗？

contents.en: I was trying to decide what to order.
I’m going to have the steak.
I’ve never had fried chicken this good before.
contents.zh: 我以前从没有吃过这么好的炸鸡。

contents.en: How do you want your steak cooked?
This chicken is undercooked.
My compliments to the chef.
Are you ready to order?
What’s your special today?
contents.zh: 你们今天的招牌菜是什么？

contents.en: Would you like any more coffee?
Do you have reservations tonight?
contents.zh: 你们今晚预定了桌位吗？

contents.en: Would you like a smoking or non-smoking table?
contents.zh: 您要吸烟区的桌子还是禁烟区的?

contents.en: Can I look at a menu?
Would you like any dessert?
What’s the soup of the day?

titles.en: lesson49 IN THE BARBER’S AND HAIRDRESSER’S

contents.en: I think I just need a trim.
contents.zh: 我想我需要修剪一下头发。

contents.en: And would you like a quick shampoo and rinse?
You can never be too careful with a customer’s hair.
contents.zh: 你对待客人的头发越仔细越好。

contents.en: Just a little trim on the top and shave it close on the sides.
contents.zh: 稍微修剪一下头顶上的头发，边上的剪短一些。

contents.en: Something new would be nice.
Do you want a little off the top?
Should I taper the back?
How about a shampoo?
How do you want your hair cut?
I’ll try to fix the side.
contents.zh: 我会尽量修剪一下侧面的。

contents.en: Do you want a perm?
I don’t need a shave.
That’s too short in the back.
I have a hair in my eye.
Just comb the hair back a little.
My client has made some very convincing allegations of police brutality.
contents.zh: 我的当事人对警察的暴力行为提出了一些令人信服的指控。

contents.en: He claims that your officers assaulted him.
contents.zh: 他声称你的警官殴打了他。

contents.en: Do you have any proof of these claims?
contents.zh: 这些指控你有什么证据吗？

contents.en: You’ll be hearing from me soon.
contents.zh: 你很快会收到我的消息的。

contents.en: I need to file a missing person’s report.
contents.zh: 我需要报案，有人失踪了。

contents.en: Arrests have declined this month.
contents.zh: 这个月逮捕的人数减少了。

contents.en: Can you identify the suspect?
He resisted arrest violently.
I want to call my lawyer.
contents.zh: 我想给我的律师打电话。

contents.en: We just have a few questions for you.
contents.zh: 我们有几个问题想问你。

contents.en: The officer was very helpful to me.
contents.zh: 这位警官对我帮助很大。

contents.en: Are you sure the suspect fired more than once?
contents.zh: 你确信嫌疑犯放火不止一次了吗？

contents.en: That area is out of our jurisdiction.
contents.zh: 那个区域不在我们司法权管辖范围内。

contents.en: This is the busiest precinct in the city.
contents.zh: 这是这个城市最繁忙的管辖区。

contents.en: I need your signature on this report.
contents.zh: 我需要你在这报告上签名。

contents.en: Welcome to the Comfort Hotel.
I just need a room for two.
Do you have any vacancies?
One double bed will be fine.
Would you like a discount on your room charge?
contents.zh: 你的住宿费需要打折吗？

contents.en: I’m like a wake-up call.
Would you like some help with your bags?
We don’t allow pets in our rooms.
contents.zh: 我们房间不允许宠物入内。

contents.en: Fresh towels are in the bathroom.
Room service can be called at the front desk.
Do you want a single or double bed?
contents.zh: 您要单人床还是双人床？

contents.en: The elevator is at the end of the hall.
Outside calls will be added to your bill.
contents.zh: 外线电话费会记在您的账单上的。

contents.en: I don’t have any hot water in my room.
I need a taxi to the airport.
contents.zh: 我需要一辆出租车去机场。

contents.en: Please have a seat.
How do you feel about working on weekends?
contents.zh: 你觉得周末上班怎么样？

contents.en: The yacht market is slow this time of the year.
contents.zh: 一年中的这个时候，游艇市场很低靡。

contents.en: You haven’t made a single sale in the past 3 weeks.
contents.zh: 过去的三个星期里，你一笔销售业务也没有做成。

contents.en: I’ll try to help you make a dent in some of that work.
contents.zh: 我会尽量帮你着手其中的一些工作。

contents.en: How does this fax machine work?
Is the repairman coming to fix the photocopier?
contents.zh: 修理人员来修复印机了吗？

contents.en: I’m going on a break to get some coffee.
contents.zh: 我要休息一下，去喝点咖啡。

contents.en: These accounts need to be paid immediately.
I heard there’re going to lay off some people this quarter.
contents.zh: 我听说这个季度要裁一些人。

contents.en: Sales have gone way up this month.
I left the papers on my desk.
contents.zh: 我把文件放在桌子上了。

contents.en: We need to cut costs somewhere in this office.
contents.zh: 我们办公室必须削减开支了。

contents.en: Has the outgoing mail left for the day?
contents.zh: 要寄出的邮件今天寄出了吗？

contents.en: Can someone answer that phone?
contents.zh: 有谁能去接一下电话吗？

contents.en: Do you know what bus leads to Memorial Stadium?
contents.zh: 你知道什么车去纪念碑体育馆吗？

contents.en: There should be a bus stop right at the Stadium.
contents.zh: 在体育馆应该有一站的。

contents.en: Do you know what bus is going to the theater?
contents.zh: 你知道几路公共汽车去剧院吗？

contents.en: It’s about 3 stops from here-maybe 15 minutes.
contents.zh: 离这儿大约三站，也许15分钟。

contents.en: This says the last bus leaves at 9:45.
contents.zh: 这上面说，最后一班车9：45开。

contents.en: Our bus is late.
That bus is too crowded to board.
contents.zh: 那辆车太拥挤了，上不了。

contents.en: Can you read the bus schedule on that sign?
contents.zh: 你能看清站牌上的公共汽车时刻表吗？

contents.en: The benches are too wet to sit on.
contents.zh: 这些长椅子太湿了没法坐。

contents.en: That bus needs some new brakes.
contents.zh: 那辆公共汽车需要新刹车了。

contents.en: The exhaust fumes are choking me.
How much is the fare for the bus?
There are no seats left on the bus.
contents.zh: 你知道什么车去纪念碑体育馆吗？

contents.en: Can you give me change for the bus?
Is this bus going uptown?
Thank you for flying with Skyway Airlines.
contents.zh: 感谢您乘坐航路航空公司的航班。

contents.en: May I see your ticket,please?
My shoulder bag is carry-on luggage.
Boarding will begin in about 30 minutes.
When does your flight land?
contents.zh: 你的航班什么时候着陆？

contents.en: What terminal am I leaving from?
contents.zh: 我最后从哪个出口出来？

contents.en: The security check is going to take a while.
contents.zh: 安全检查要花一点时间。

contents.en: I hope the X-ray machine doesn’t damage my film.
contents.zh: 我希望X光机不会损坏我的胶卷。

contents.en: Don’t even joke about having a bomb or a gun.
contents.zh: 甚至不要开玩笑地说你身上有炸弹或枪。

contents.en: This is going to be a long flight.
The arrival time has been delayed due to bad weather.
contents.zh: 由于天气不好，到达时间延误了。

contents.en: That bag is too heavy to be carry-on luggage.
contents.zh: 那个包太重了，不能当作随身行李。

contents.en: Where is the baggage claim area?
This is your boarding pass.
May I see your passport?
It should be here in the next two or three minutes.
contents.zh: 再过两三分钟就该到了。

contents.en: It’s just getting on my nerves.
When does the next train leave for New Orleans?
contents.zh: 下一班开往新奥尔良的火车什么时候开？

contents.en: I’ve got kind of a problem.
There are Tri-State Rail System trains leaving every half hour for the city.
contents.zh: 三州铁路系统开往这个城市的火车每半个小时一班。

contents.en: This is a new section of railroad track.
The Northeast corridor is the busiest section of the country for train travel.
contents.zh: 西北走廊是这个国家火车旅行最繁忙的区域。

contents.en: That’s the last call to board the train.
contents.zh: 那是最后一次上车通知了。

contents.en: I think I hear the train coming.
I hope I get a window seat.
contents.zh: 我希望我有靠窗口的座位。

contents.en: Why do these trains always leave at the end of the day?
contents.zh: 为什么这些火车总是在一天要结束的时候才发车？

contents.en: I bought my tickets over the phone.
I want to buy a ticket for Denver to Los Angeles.
contents.zh: 我想买一张丹佛到洛杉矶的车票。

contents.en: Have you seen our conductor?
contents.zh: 你看到我们的售票员了吗？

contents.en: I’m going to get a drink from the dining car.

titles.en: lesson56 AT THE DISNEY THEME PARK

contents.en: He’s not as common around here as Mickey Mouse.
contents.zh: 在这里他没有米老鼠那么有名。

contents.en: My favorite character was Donald Duck.
contents.zh: 我最喜欢的形象是唐老鸭。

contents.en: He seemed like a regular guy.
What do you want to see next?
It sounds like you prefer old movies in general.
contents.zh: 听起来你一般更喜欢老电影。

contents.en: Let’s go see Space Mountain.
That roller coaster terrified me.
contents.zh: 那过山车真把我吓坏了。

contents.en: Do you see Goofy?
I don’t want to go to the gift shop and spend more money.
contents.zh: 我不想去礼品店花更多的钱。

contents.en: I remember coming here when I was a little kid.
contents.zh: 我记得当我还是个孩子的时候来过这里。

contents.en: We spent the past hour at Main Street USA.
contents.zh: 上一个小时我们在“美国主要大街”度过。

contents.en: I think Disney World is too much of a tourist trap.
contents.zh: 我认为迪斯尼乐园太吸引游客了。

contents.en: Did you know they just opened a Disney World in Japan?
contents.zh: 你知道吗，日本刚开了一个迪斯尼乐园。

contents.en: I heard they might open another in China.
contents.zh: 我听说可能在中国也会开一个。

contents.en: I’m staying at the hotel at Epcot Center.
Don’t you look at yourself in the mirror too?
contents.zh: 难道你自己不照镜子吗？

contents.en: They must work out all the time.
Why do you go to the gym so much?
contents.zh: 你为什么经常去健身房？

contents.en: It’s good for me to be healthy.
It’s never good to put such a high value on appearances.
contents.zh: 如此重视外表是不好的。

contents.en: My muscles feel numb.
I can’t move a muscle.
I’m exhausted.
I’m going to spend a few more minutes on the exercise bike.
contents.zh: 我要在骑车器上再锻炼一会儿。

contents.en: It’s too crowded in the gym at night.
contents.zh: 晚上健身房里太拥挤了。

contents.en: Someone needs to fix the leg press machine.
contents.zh: 得有人来修理一下压腿机。

contents.en: I’m going to relax in the sauna.
contents.zh: 我要去泡桑拿，放松一下。

contents.en: How many more exercises do you have to do?
How often do you work out?
He’s a firefighter,so he has to exercise often.
contents.zh: 他是个消防队员，所以他必须经常锻炼。

contents.en: I have to take a break for a second.
When I was running,I twisted my ankle.
contents.zh: 我跑步的时候扭到了脚踝。

contents.en: Just don’t neglect an injury.
That was a good game we played.
contents.zh: 那场比赛我们打得不错。

contents.en: We’re in the middle of a game.
He’s playing too rough.
We can still win this game.
contents.zh: 我们还是能赢得这场比赛。

contents.en: We need to start playing hard.
contents.zh: 我们必须开始艰苦比赛了。

contents.en: You guys are getting lazy.
That referee is blind.
contents.zh: 那个裁判简直是瞎了眼。

contents.en: I can’t believe I dropped that pass.
contents.zh: 我简直不相信，传过来的球我竟然没有接住。

contents.en: If it keeps raining,we’ll have to stop the game.
contents.zh: 如果雨继续下的话，我们就必须终止比赛了。

contents.en: I think he was out of bounds.
That goal was pure luck.
Who has the ball?
I’m just looking for your travel section.
contents.zh: 我在找你们书店旅游方面的书。

contents.en: Is there a specific book you’re looking for?
I wanted to see what books you had about that.
contents.zh: 我想看看关于那方面你有什么书。

contents.en: This book is very popular right now with little boys.
contents.zh: 现在这本书很受小男孩们欢迎。

contents.en: This is a classic.
I want to return this book.
Can you gift-wrap this book?
contents.zh: 你能把这本书礼品包装一下吗？

contents.en: We’ll call you when your book comes in.
contents.zh: 你的书到了，我们就会给你打电话。

contents.en: My friend helped write this book.
contents.zh: 我的朋友帮我写了这本书。

contents.en: I’ve read good reviews about that novel.
contents.zh: 我读过一些关于那部小说很不错的评论。

contents.en: It’s hard to find a good book about the Chinese language.
contents.zh: 很难找到一本好的汉语方面的书。

contents.en: Do you have any road atlases?
contents.zh: 你们这里有没有道路交通图册？

contents.en: Why is this book in the psychology section?
contents.zh: 为什么这本书在心理学专区？

contents.en: Do you have the first edition of this book?
contents.zh: 你们有这本书的第一版吗？

contents.en: They have some foreign magazines here.
contents.zh: 他们这里有一些国外杂志。

contents.en: You’re always on the phone with your mom for hours.
contents.zh: 你总是同你妈妈打电话，一打就是几个小时。

contents.en: I’m not dressed.
I need you to do me one more favor.
contents.zh: 我需要你再帮我一个忙。

contents.en: It’s becoming really messy in there.
It’s your turn to cut the grass.
I’ll take the dog out for a walk.
You need to clean the floor this afternoon.
The refrigerator light isn’t working.
We’re almost out of toothpaste.
contents.zh: 我们的牙膏快要用完了。

contents.en: I just want to relax and watch TV after work.
contents.zh: 下班后我只想看电视，放松放松。

contents.en: What’s for dinner tonight?
I don’t feel like cooking tonight.
I spent most of the afternoon taking a nap.
contents.zh: 我下午的大部分时间都在打盹。

contents.en: Your parents are coming over for dinner tomorrow.
Have you met our new neighbors across the street?
contents.zh: 你见过我们街对面的新邻居吗？

contents.en: This soup is incredible! Have you tried it yet?
contents.zh: 这汤真是不错！你尝过吗？

contents.en: I was trying to decide what to order.
I’m going to have the steak.
I’ve never had fried chicken this good before.
contents.zh: 我以前从没有吃过这么好的炸鸡。

contents.en: How do you want your steak cooked?
This chicken is undercooked.
My compliments to the chef.
Are you ready to order?
What’s your special today?
contents.zh: 你们今天的招牌菜是什么？

contents.en: Would you like any more coffee?
Do you have reservations tonight?
contents.zh: 你们今晚预定了桌位吗？

contents.en: Would you like a smoking or non-smoking table?
contents.zh: 您要吸烟区的桌子还是禁烟区的?

contents.en: Can I look at a menu?
Would you like any dessert?
What’s the soup of the day?
